intro: Castilla gummifera, commonly known as the rubber tree or Castilla, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which has been historically used for various industrial purposes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in humid, well-drained soils. Castilla gummifera is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitats.
